result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole R. O'Claire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicole R. O'Claire is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicole R. O'Claire was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole R. O'Claire

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
03:46 pm - Defendant Nicole R. O'Claire in court with attorney Mary M. Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss count 2 - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Michlig/Hogan/Court statement to sentencing.  If probation is revoked will sentence jail CS to any sentence serving.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP 1 yr
Fine $2800
DNA Surcharge $200
Extradition Fee $400 (WF)
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given

Defendant Nicole R. O'Claire not in court.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
3:22
Defendant not in court- Hogan statement to non appearance - is a waiver of prelim - off record for defendant to appear telephonically - 3:22 - Back on record 3:27 -  Court statement to defendant -  Defendant statement to Counsel - Hogan statement - Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.
Bail continued  Arraignment scheduled for August 14, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
Invoice for transport from St. Paul, MN to Oneida County
Preliminary hearing on August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

4:27 p.m. Defendant Nicole R. O'Claire in court with attorney Mary M Hogan.  DA intern, Noel Lawrence, appears under the student practice rule. Court questions defendant on non-appearance--- originally scheduled for 1:30 p.m. today. Hogan statement; Hogan waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
01:34 pm - Attorney Mary M Hogan in court.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hogan states defendant called and is enroute from Ashland.
Voluntary appearance on June 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

10:36 am - Attorney Mary M Hogan in court.  Defendant does not appear.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  Hogan states spoke briefly with defendant - Defendant stated thought she had set up ride with parents, but they did not come to get her, lives in Ashland, 2 hrs away.  Court authorizes warrant.

01:5 pm - Defendant Nicole R. O'Claire in court, via video,  with attorney Mary M Hogan.  Defendant Nicole R. O'Claire in custody.  Steven M Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Noel Lawrence, under the student practice rule.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading.  Michlig/Hogan to bond.  Court sets cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 10:30 am.
per Deda at ONSO now in ONSO by lock and load
Per Deda - in custody in Minnesota - detainer placed.
